verses.roman:
ānandonmāde uṭhāya bhāvera taraṅga
nānā-bhāva-sainye upajila yuddha-raṅga

synonyms: ānanda-unmāde—the madness of transcendental bliss; uṭhāya—causes to arise; bhāvera—of emotion; taraṅga—waves; nānā—various; bhāva—emotions; sainye—among soldiers; upajila—there appeared; yuddha-raṅga—fighting.
translation: The madness of transcendental bliss created waves of various emotions. The emotions appeared like opposing soldiers staging a fight.
